Raging like that on a game like this just does not sound justified to me.Agreed\, P1 was an exceptional strong story\, the ending was exceptionally engaging\, and the follow-up to it was superb.P2 is about something else. It's not about a satisfying end\, people getting what they want\, dancing unicorns on a infected rainbow.It's about paranoia\, mental decay\, people going nuts in a world gone beyond nuts. It gives us insight in two people coping with this daily sledgehammer of mental abuse in their own way. And the interesting part is that those two people's lives are entwined in something resembling a chaotic death spiral of revenge and spite.There's a (ugly\, nasty\, cringy) beauty in that. How they cope with their challenges\, the injustice& losses they endure. It makes this story about a antagonistic struggle of GOD (capable of mercy\, even when she sees so much death and inhumanity) vs the DEVIL (can't get closure on the death of a loved one who she can't forgive for what he's done) - it's complicated.Abby beating Ellie at her game (being sneaky)\, then Ellie beating Abby at hers (brawling) is some kind of genius master plot awesomeness I have not seen often. Which fit perfectly in the antagonistic clash of them both against each other. We had the privilege being part of that process\, understanding how it shaped their actions and their own sanity.It made me frustrated and sad to see what Ellie has become.It made me feel relief that there is still sanity in that distopic world by seeing Abby make the arguable mistake of giving mercy twice\, even though it cost her all her loved ones. Even though I thought she just was a generic 'baddy' at first.Maybe that is why so many people are so frustrated and give this title a bad score. They don't like what Ellie (and being the player\, they themselves) become. Or maybe they just don't understand what the story is about.That's the danger of a story that's not aimed to please the viewer. They might get frustrated\, or just miss the point.But that just makes this game a misunderstood *masterpiece* to me.… Expand
